title.label: Simply needs to be updated to current standards.

content.label:
My problem with this game is just how much of the action is obscured by UI elements and pillarboxing. There‚Äôs a large set of borders on each side of the display, a huge box that‚Äôs persistently showing faces and temporary goals... and since it hasn‚Äôt been updated for the iPhone X, there‚Äôs enormous pillarboxing.

And that‚Äôs sad because at the core it‚Äôs a very fun game with easily the most functional joystick I‚Äôve experienced in a mobile fighter... but it‚Äôs very hard to get immersed in the experience with such a thick concentration of pillarboxing, borders and oversized UI elements everywhere.

Compare and contrast with Street Fighter IV: Championship Edition. I hate to even make such a comparison because I do and always have liked KoF more than SF, but they use the hardware properly. The entire iPhone X screen is used, and it‚Äôs used to showcase very minimal UI elements so that the screen can properly showcase the atmosphere and the fighters.

I hope the future SNK games will be as good as this one:) I purchased KOF 97 and 98, and Samurai Shodown II recently but they all suffer from bad controls and the difficulty for KOF 97 and Samurai Shodown II are both frustratingly and irritatingly difficult and it makes them unenjoyable to play.... But this game is the best among the rest of all current fighting games on the iOS. Thanks again SNK!
